findings.issue: References ASCE/SEI 7 without specifying the year. DSA requires ASCE 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022. This is critical for seismic design compliance.
findings.existingText: Structural Performance: Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE/SEI 7.
findings.replacementText: Structural Performance: Hangers and supports for HVAC piping and equipment shall withstand the effects of gravity loads and stresses within limits and under conditions indicated according to ASCE 7-22 as adopted by CBC 2022.

findings.issue: Missing DSA-specific seismic restraint requirements and certification documentation. DSA IR A-6 requires specific seismic bracing, certification, and pre-approval documentation for hangers and supports.
findings.replacementText: Seismic Restraint: Design and certify seismic restraints per DSA IR A-6 and OSHPD seismic requirements. Provide seismic certification documentation and OSHPD pre-approval (OPA) where required for hangers and supports.

findings.issue: References ASTM C 533 which has been withdrawn. The current standard is ASTM C1427 for calcium silicate insulation.
findings.existingText:
Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C 533, Type I calcium silicate with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.

Insulation-Insert Material for Hot Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C 533, Type I calcium silicate with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.
findings.replacementText:
Insulation-Insert Material for Cold Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C1427, Type I calcium silicate with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.

Insulation-Insert Material for Hot Piping: Water-repellent treated, ASTM C1427, Type I calcium silicate with 100-psig minimum compressive strength.

findings.issue: References outdated structural steel standard. ASTM A 36/A 36M should be ASTM A36/A36M (current format without space).
findings.existingText: Structural Steel: ASTM A 36/A 36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.
findings.replacementText: Structural Steel: ASTM A36/A36M, carbon-steel plates, shapes, and bars; black and galvanized.

findings.issue: References AWS D1.1/D1.1M without year. The current edition as of CBC 2022 adoption is AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020.
findings.existingText: Field Welding: Comply with AWS D1.1/D1.1M procedures for shielded, metal arc welding...
findings.replacementText: Field Welding: Comply with AWS D1.1/D1.1M:2020 procedures for shielded, metal arc welding...

findings.issue: Section number 230529 uses outdated Division 15 format. Current CSI MasterFormat uses Division 23 for HVAC. Section should be renumbered to 23 05 29.
findings.existingText: SECTION 230529 - HANGERS AND SUPPORTS
findings.replacementText: SECTION 23 05 29 - HANGERS AND SUPPORTS FOR HVAC PIPING AND EQUIPMENT

findings.issue: References Section 233113 which uses outdated Division 15 format. Should be Section 23 31 13 per current CSI MasterFormat.
findings.existingText: Section 233113 "Metal Ducts" for duct hangers and supports.
findings.replacementText: Section 23 31 13 "Metal Ducts" for duct hangers and supports.

findings.issue: References ASTM A 780 which has been withdrawn. The current standard is ASTM A780/A780M (with M suffix).
findings.existingText: Galvanized Surfaces: Clean welds, bolted connections, and abraded areas and apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A 780.
findings.replacementText: Galvanized Surfaces: Clean welds, bolted connections, and abraded areas and apply galvanizing-repair paint to comply with ASTM A780/A780M.

findings.issue: References outdated military specification MIL-A-3316C (last updated October 1987). While still technically valid, projects should consider using current ASTM standards where available.
findings.existingText: Military Specification in this article was the only standard available when this Section was written. MIL-A-3316C was last updated in October 1987.
findings.replacementText: Military Specification MIL-A-3316C is referenced below. While valid, verify current availability and consider ASTM alternatives if MIL-spec products are discontinued.

findings.existingText: Comply with requirements in Section 078413 "Penetration Firestopping"
findings.replacementText: Comply with requirements in Section 07 84 13 "Penetration Firestopping"

findings.replacementText: ASTM C553, Type II and ASTM C1290

findings.fileName: 230593 - TESTING, ADJUSTING, AND BALANCING FOR HVAC.docx
findings.issue: Requiring AABC certification for all TAB work is unnecessarily restrictive. NEBB (National Environmental Balancing Bureau) and TABB (Testing, Adjusting and Balancing Bureau) are equally qualified organizations. Limiting to AABC reduces competition and may increase costs without improving quality.
findings.existingText: TAB Contractor Qualifications: Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC.
findings.replacementText: TAB Contractor Qualifications: Engage a TAB entity certified by AABC, NEBB, or TABB.

findings.issue: Requiring inspection at only 'one location for each duct system' is inadequate for K-12 facilities which typically have multiple air handlers and extensive ductwork. This minimal inspection may miss systemic installation problems and is insufficient quality assurance for a DSA project.
findings.existingText: Extent of inspection shall be limited to one location for each duct system defined in the "Duct Insulation Schedule, General" Article.
findings.replacementText: Extent of inspection shall be limited to a minimum of three locations for each duct system defined in the "Duct Insulation Schedule, General" Article, or one location per air handling unit, whichever is greater.

findings.issue: The inspection quantities specified (three locations of straight pipe, three of threaded fittings, etc.) may be inadequate for larger K-12 campuses with extensive piping systems. A percentage-based inspection or minimum per building would be more appropriate for ensuring quality across the entire project.
findings.existingText: Extent of inspection shall be limited to three locations of straight pipe, three locations of threaded fittings...
findings.replacementText: Extent of inspection shall be a minimum of three locations of straight pipe, three locations of threaded fittings... per building or piping system, or 5% of total installations, whichever is greater.
